Anti-Human Trafficking Training for Hotels

Human Trafficking Signs

Be on the lookout for these signs of potential human trafficking:

Physical Signs:
Injuries or signs of physical abuse
Malnutrition or poor hygiene
Brandings or tattoos
Behavioral Signs:
Submissive or fearful demeanor
Lack of control over personal belongings or identification
Reluctance to talk or make eye contact
Circumstantial Signs:
Multiple individuals sharing a single room
Frequent guest turnover
Suspicious activity, such as individuals entering and exiting rooms frequently
Presence of a controlling individual
Limited personal possessions
Human Trafficking and the Law

Human trafficking is a serious crime with severe legal consequences. As a hotel employee, it is important to be aware of your legal obligations and responsibilities.

Skills for Identifying Human Trafficking

To effectively identify potential cases of human trafficking, it is important to develop the following skills:

Attention to Detail: Pay close attention to details, such as unusual guest behavior, suspicious activity, or inconsistencies in stories.
Critical Thinking: Analyze information and identify patterns that may indicate potential exploitation.
Interpersonal Skills: Communicate effectively with guests and colleagues to gather information and build rapport.
Tailored Content for Different Hotel Employee Positions

Front Desk Staff:
Pay attention to unusual reservation patterns, such as multiple rooms booked under the same name or a large number of rooms booked for an extended period.
Be alert to guests who appear to be controlled or coerced by others.
Housekeeping Staff:
Look for signs of physical abuse or neglect in rooms.
Be aware of unusual activity, such as frequent room changes or guests who avoid interaction.
Security Staff:
Monitor for suspicious activity in common areas, such as loitering or drug use.
Be prepared to intervene in situations where guests appear to be in distress.
Interactivity

Role-playing Scenarios: Participate in role-playing exercises to practice identifying and responding to potential cases of human trafficking.
Quizzes: Test your knowledge of human trafficking signs, laws, and best practices.
Partnerships

Our hotel is committed to working with anti-human trafficking organizations to combat this serious issue. We have partnered with [List of partner organizations] to provide resources and support to victims of human trafficking.

By being aware of the signs of human trafficking and taking appropriate action, you can help to protect vulnerable individuals and make a difference in the fight against this crime.
